page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF FORDHAM AREA
page.content: Our area is rural with undulating countryside. Most of the people live in the small village of Fordham.In the village there is an interesting old church, part of which dates back to the 9th century.The housing is a mixture of old and new with some unusual beamed and thatched properties. There are two public houses serving snacks and meals.Also two shops, a Post Office (general stores), and a butcher's. Behind the village hall, built after the first world war, there is a children's playing field. Surrounding the village are large open fields, mainly arable land, although some animals are kept. Pleasant walks through footpaths are available in this area. In the distance you can see the ancient town of Colchester
